column1: '''Háma''' was the Doorward of [[Théoden]] and Captain of the King's Guard of [[Rohan]]. He was a loyal and devoted man, though he often anticipated his orders.
Háma served as the doorguard of [[Edoras]], the abode of the [[Kings of Rohan
column3: 3019}}, four guests arrived at his post: [[Aragorn]], [[Gimli]], [[Legolas]] and [[Gandalf]].<ref>{{App
column4: Great}}</ref>  He stood by the rules of the house, and ordered them all to surrender their weapons. He entered into a long argument with Aragorn who refused to hand [[Andúril]] to anyone else until he agreed to do so at the wish of Gandalf. He permitted Gandalf to keep his staff, a deliberate decision which would prove decisive in the healing of his king.

column1: For this oversight, Háma was reprimanded by [[Théoden]], and briefly relieved of his position as the doorguard. Háma did his Lord's bidding, and also released [[Éomer]] from captivity. The King's sister-son was imprisoned by [[Gríma
column2: Gríma Wormtongue]], who was shortly before overthrown with the use of Gandalf's staff. Háma arrested Gríma, and found various missing items in his possession, including [[Herugrim]], the King's sword.<ref name="King"/>

column1: Háma rode with Théoden to the [[Hornburg]], and fought in the [[Battle of the Hornburg
column2: battle]] that ensued shortly after. He fell before the great gate, and his body was hacked to pieces by a horde of [[Uruk-hai
column4: III10}}</ref>  He was given the honour of being buried in a grave of his own under the shadow of the Hornburg. column1: On [[5 March]] when Théoden rejected the words of [[Saruman]] the hewing of Háma's body before the gate of the Hornburg was among the grievances he cited.<ref name="Voice"/>
